summary: „Die Pest“: Warum ihr diese Erfolgsserie nicht verpassen dürft!
title: „Die Pest“: Warum ihr diese Erfolgsserie nicht verpassen dürft!
body:
Die historische Thriller-Serie über rätselhafte Morde im Renaissance-Sevilla hat in Spanien sogar „Games of Thrones“ vom Quoten-Thron gestoßen und ist in Deutschland ab dem 19. Juli auf Sky Atlantic HD zu sehen.

Am Ende des 16. Jahrhunderts ist die andalusische Metropole das Zentrum des spanischen Seehandels, wie auch der spanischen Kunst. Da die Stadt das Monopol auf Geschäfte mit Übersee hat, treffen in Sevilla ständig Menschen aus aller Welt aufeinander, manchmal friedlich, manchmal weniger.

Inmitten des babylonischen Treibens taucht ein ehemaliger Soldat wieder auf, der einst aus der Stadt fliehen musste: Mateo (Pablo Monlenero) war wegen des Drucks verbotener Bücher verurteilt worden. Er kehrt zurück, weil er einem verstorbenen Freund versprochen hat, dessen Sohn Valerio (Sergio Castellanos) zu finden. In Sevilla angekommen, wird Mateo sofort verhaftet. Ihm droht die Todesstrafe, doch der General-Inquisitor der katholischen Kirche (Manolo Solo) macht ihm ein Angebot: Wenn Mateo eine rätselhafte Mordserie aufklärt, kommt er mit dem Leben davon.

Die Leichen, die Mateo untersucht, weisen alle eine unheimliche Gemeinsamkeit auf: Sie sind mit Zeichen des Teufels markiert. Doch bei seinen Ermittlungen merkt Mateo schnell, dass hier nicht einfach nur ein wahnsinniger Täter am Werk ist. Er wird in eine Verschwörung verwickelt, die bis in die höchsten Kreise der Stadt zu reichen scheint. Während Mateo fieberhaft nach dem Mörder sucht, wird die Lage in Sevilla immer düsterer. Denn die Beulenpest rafft immer mehr Menschen dahin. In diesem apokalyptischen Chaos findet Mateo schließlich eine heiße Spur, die zu den Anführern der Protestanten führt.

 Zehn Millionen Euro kostete die Erfolgsserie

„Die Pest“ ist eine Produktion des größten spanischen Pay-TV Senders Movie+. Die zehn Millionen Euro teure Serie erreichte die besten Zuschauerzahlen des Senders und übertrumpfte damit sogar den vorherigen Quoten-König, die siebte Staffel „Game of Thrones“.

Die Regie führt Alberto Rodriguez, der sich in Spanien bereits mit diversen Crime-Thrillern einen Namen gemacht hat. Sein Film „Marshland“ („La isla mìnima“), der in den 80ern kurz nach dem Ende der Franco-Diktatur spielt, verbindet bereits ein historisches Setting mit dem Serienkiller-Genre.

“Er stellt die Werkzeuge des Genres in den Dienst der Geschichte”

Für die packende Geschichte heimsten Rodriguez und sein Team zehn Goyas – der wichtigste spanische Filmpreis – und sechs weitere Nominierungen ein. Unter anderem für das beste Drehbuch, das Rodriguez zusammen mit Rafael Cobos schrieb, der nun auch wieder für das Buch zu „Die Pest“ verantwortlich ist. Die spanische Tageszeitung „El Mundo“ urteilte über die Serie: „Fernsehen wie nie zuvor. Rodriguez schafft es, die Werkzeuge des Genres in den Dienst der Geschichte zu stellen.“

Auf Sky Sky Atlantic HD ist der opulente Sechsteiler exklusiv ab 19. Juli donnerstags um 20.15 Uhr in Doppelfolgen zu sehen und auf Abruf auch auf Sky Go und Sky On Demand sowie mit dem Streaming-Dienst Sky Ticket, wahlweise auch im spanischen Original.

(Bilder: Sky Deutschland)

summary: [NO SPOILERS] Who originally designed the Stark Direwolf?
title: [NO SPOILERS] Who originally designed the Stark Direwolf?
body:
Hi reddit, this is my first post and something I’m genuinely curious about.
I haven’t been able to find anything online, but I’m assuming it was someone in the Art Department.

I’ve never really thought about the fact that one person designed this, and people have tattoos, merch, and make their own sigils out of wood or metal, and etc etc, all based on this one image that one person whipped up.

Apologies if this is a well known fact and I’m not using google properly.

https://i.redd.it/lhl2buo3vva11.jpg



Source: https://ift.tt/2NtXUpn

summary: [SPOILERS] Season 6 Episode 10 - Aegon revealed
title: [SPOILERS] Season 6 Episode 10 - Aegon revealed
body:
I always thought that in S06E10 when Bran is watching Lyanna and Ned Stark in the tower where she is dying, I didn’t realize if you turned the volume way up on your TV you can actually hear what she is saying. She says, “His name is Aegon. If Robert finds out, he’ll kill him. You know he will. You have to protect him. Promise me Ned. Promise me.” I didn’t think that Jon’s name was revealed as Aegon until Sam and Bran discuss it, but it actually was here.



Source: https://ift.tt/2L7Anhj

summary: renly baratheon childhood headcanons #2 penrose is renly’s godfather and a friend of  his parents who gets called ‘uncle’. as a...
body:
renly baratheon childhood headcanons #2

  • penrose is renly’s godfather and a friend of his parents who gets called ‘uncle’. as a baby, renly had colic and used to cry and cry for hours until robert and stannis felt like crying along with him. penrose had a way of picking him up and rocking him gently that used to help soothe him, so he was often ‘on call’ during the night for when renly woke. (he and cressen shared guardianship of the boys for years until cressen died when renly was 8 and penrose took over full time).
  • 'penrose’ (or peppy) was renly’s first word and he used to babble at penrose and laugh whenever anyone tried to correct him. then it went from peppy to nose (which he found equally hilarious) before he managed the full penrose at two years old. he loves climbing on penrose and often uses his knees/trouser legs to pull himself up as he’s learning to walk.
  • he takes his first steps running away from penrose whilst he’s trying to give him a bath (renly wants to watch the fish in their tank in stannis’ room). penrose soon learns that he has to resort to bribing renly to go for baths/to bed/etc. with storytime, and before long renly knows we’re going on a bear hunt and where the wild things are off by heart.
  • renly has his first day at nursery when he’s two, and he cries all morning until penrose picks him up at lunch. from then on it’s a daily battle every morning to get renly to let go of penrose’s shirt/tie/jacket/anything he can get his tiny hands on to allow penrose to go to work. (renly attends nursery two days a week.)
  • i love/hate the idea that renly never knew his parents because they died when he was really tiny (like a year old or even younger). robert, who was like 12 at the time and stannis who was 10, remember them well, and kind of resent their younger brother for not sharing that pain. they’re fiercely protective of the memory of their parents so when renly’s nursery playworker calls penrose 'daddy’ ('look, renly, daddy’s here to pick you up with robert!’) robert’s face is mutinous and she gets an angry talking to. renly just crawls over and beams all over his face, holding his arms up to be picked up and immediately putting the end of penrose’s tie in his mouth.
  • renly’s first day at school, he has to fill out a book all about himself (name, how old he is, self portrait, family, pets, etc.) and he puts penrose’s name and picture under 'dad’. penrose is so touched he cries, but robert is furious and yells that penrose isn’t their dad and never has been, and from then on renly is scared of robert and avoids writing about his family at school.
  • he has quite a lot of friends at school but still isn’t very close to any of them until loras joins the school when renly is in year two. this tiny reception student three years younger than him with wildly curly hair who falls over on the playground near renly and just sets his jaw and blinks the tears back fiercely. renly adores him at first sight and takes him to the front office to get his knee cleaned up and a plaster put on it, and then offers to play with loras next break time. they play cops and robbers and maidens-and-monsters and come into my castle, and before long they’re as thick as thieves and introducing alerie and penrose to each other at the school gates whilst begging for a playdate that weekend. (imagine how happy they are to find out that loras’ family have moved into a house on the cul-de-sac opposite renly’s.)

reblog.comment:
renly baratheon childhood headcanons #2

  • penrose is renly’s godfather and a friend of his parents who gets called ‘uncle’. as a baby, renly had colic and used to cry and cry for hours until robert and stannis felt like crying along with him. penrose had a way of picking him up and rocking him gently that used to help soothe him, so he was often ‘on call’ during the night for when renly woke. (he and cressen shared guardianship of the boys for years until cressen died when renly was 8 and penrose took over full time).
  • 'penrose’ (or peppy) was renly’s first word and he used to babble at penrose and laugh whenever anyone tried to correct him. then it went from peppy to nose (which he found equally hilarious) before he managed the full penrose at two years old. he loves climbing on penrose and often uses his knees/trouser legs to pull himself up as he’s learning to walk.
  • he takes his first steps running away from penrose whilst he’s trying to give him a bath (renly wants to watch the fish in their tank in stannis’ room). penrose soon learns that he has to resort to bribing renly to go for baths/to bed/etc. with storytime, and before long renly knows we’re going on a bear hunt and where the wild things are off by heart.
  • renly has his first day at nursery when he’s two, and he cries all morning until penrose picks him up at lunch. from then on it’s a daily battle every morning to get renly to let go of penrose’s shirt/tie/jacket/anything he can get his tiny hands on to allow penrose to go to work. (renly attends nursery two days a week.)
  • i love/hate the idea that renly never knew his parents because they died when he was really tiny (like a year old or even younger). robert, who was like 12 at the time and stannis who was 10, remember them well, and kind of resent their younger brother for not sharing that pain. they’re fiercely protective of the memory of their parents so when renly’s nursery playworker calls penrose 'daddy’ ('look, renly, daddy’s here to pick you up with robert!’) robert’s face is mutinous and she gets an angry talking to. renly just crawls over and beams all over his face, holding his arms up to be picked up and immediately putting the end of penrose’s tie in his mouth.
  • renly’s first day at school, he has to fill out a book all about himself (name, how old he is, self portrait, family, pets, etc.) and he puts penrose’s name and picture under 'dad’. penrose is so touched he cries, but robert is furious and yells that penrose isn’t their dad and never has been, and from then on renly is scared of robert and avoids writing about his family at school.
  • he has quite a lot of friends at school but still isn’t very close to any of them until loras joins the school when renly is in year two. this tiny reception student three years younger than him with wildly curly hair who falls over on the playground near renly and just sets his jaw and blinks the tears back fiercely. renly adores him at first sight and takes him to the front office to get his knee cleaned up and a plaster put on it, and then offers to play with loras next break time. they play cops and robbers and maidens-and-monsters and come into my castle, and before long they’re as thick as thieves and introducing alerie and penrose to each other at the school gates whilst begging for a playdate that weekend. (imagine how happy they are to find out that loras’ family have moved into a house on the cul-de-sac opposite renly’s.)

renly baratheon childhood headcanons #2

  • penrose is renly’s godfather and a friend of his parents who gets called ‘uncle’. as a baby, renly had colic and used to cry and cry for hours until robert and stannis felt like crying along with him. penrose had a way of picking him up and rocking him gently that used to help soothe him, so he was often ‘on call’ during the night for when renly woke. (he and cressen shared guardianship of the boys for years until cressen died when renly was 8 and penrose took over full time).
  • 'penrose’ (or peppy) was renly’s first word and he used to babble at penrose and laugh whenever anyone tried to correct him. then it went from peppy to nose (which he found equally hilarious) before he managed the full penrose at two years old. he loves climbing on penrose and often uses his knees/trouser legs to pull himself up as he’s learning to walk.

  • renly has his first day at nursery when he’s two, and he cries all morning until penrose picks him up at lunch. from then on it’s a daily battle every morning to get renly to let go of penrose’s shirt/tie/jacket/anything he can get his tiny hands on to allow penrose to go to work. (renly attends nursery two days a week.)
  • i love/hate the idea that renly never knew his parents because they died when he was really tiny (like a year old or even younger). robert, who was like 12 at the time and stannis who was 10, remember them well, and kind of resent their younger brother for not sharing that pain. they’re fiercely protective of the memory of their parents so when renly’s nursery playworker calls penrose 'daddy’ ('look, renly, daddy’s here to pick you up with robert!’) robert’s face is mutinous and she gets an angry talking to. renly just crawls over and beams all over his face, holding his arms up to be picked up and immediately putting the end of penrose’s tie in his mouth.
